result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel Jon Kurtz

1:14 PM Defendant Gabriel Jon Kurtz in court.  Attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for State of Wisconsin. Waived reading of Information Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant will seek an attorney .
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:33 AM Defendant Gabriel Jon Kurtz in court.  Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing waived.  Defendant was advised of right to attorney and waived that right  at this time.   The Court finds that the defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of his own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.  State asking for 30 days to file information.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. Waived reading of the complaint Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
